content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 143.6 - Applications for shift pay differentials not favorably considered

State Regulations

An application filed with the Director of Classification and

Compensation shall not receive favorable consideration by him under the
provisions of subdivision 5 of section
130
of the

Civil Service Law in any case when the application is based essentially
upon: (a) a comparison between
salaries paid for a given occupation and those paid for the same or related
occupations in the State service without reference to the payment of a higher
rate of pay for work on a shift other than a normal day shift; or
(b) a comparison between salaries paid for a
given occupation and those paid for the same or related occupations in the

State service in cases where the basic salaries plus the shift differentials
being paid for the given occupation are approximately the same as or less than
the basic salary range for the same or related occupation in the State service; or
(c) a comparison between
salaries paid for a given occupation outside the State and those paid for the
same or related occupations in the State service; or
(d) other matters or considerations provided
for under sections
120
and
121
of the

Civil Service Law or which are otherwise reviewable pursuant to law or any
rules or regulations having the force and effect of law. Notes
